alert.note: Alert for Campbell; Pendleton (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 20 at 4:40AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 AM EDT FOR NORTHWESTERN BRACKEN...SOUTHERN CAMPBELL...NORTHEASTERN PENDLETON...CLERMONT AND NORTHWESTERN BROWN COUNTIES... At 440 AM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Amelia, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Georgetown, Amelia, Mount Orab, Bethel, New Richmond, Williamsburg, Batavia, Felicity, Withamsville, Owensville, Hamersville, Fayetteville, Higginsport, Mentor, Moscow, St. Martin, Neville, California, Chilo and Mount Auburn. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
